We also use their curbside to-go service weekly and their to-go staff is absolutely exceptional. In fact, we go there so frequently and use their curbside service so often and have never had any problems. So, I just had to make sure I wrote them an excellent review, because the staff at this particular location really deserve the recognition!

I'm not a huge fan of CPK's food.  I think it generally tends to be pretty mediocre and is overpriced for what it is.  However, this location is much better in terms of service than the location in downtown Palo Alto, where we had a terrible experience (see  ) My salmon pasta was pretty bland but edible.   My fiance liked his pizza ("The Works") pretty well.  The service was decent.  We will definitely go here as opposed to the one in DTPA when my fiance gets a CPK craving.

Went here with my wife and daughter after getting pictures with Santa at the Stanford Center and all I can say is meh... It was a rainy day so the outside tables were not being used. Their inside space is cramped with almost no waiting area. My wife found her spaghetti to be a little too salty, my daughter's cheese pizza was....a cheese pizza. Our complimentary bread was delivered with a mumbled explanation about 3/4 or the way thru the meal. I got the creamy garlic pasta and for $3 had them add chicken which amounted to 8 (I counted them) measly chunks of chicken. They were hard to find being the same color of the cream sauce and pasta. I moved the chicken to the side and asked the waiter " so this is $3 of chicken?". His concerned reply...."yeah". So I say meh... The place is cramped and the meals are not a good value for the $$$. Won't be coming here ever again.

Normally, I would never write a review about this chain but this one evening was just horrible so I've decided to write about it. Two Saturday nights ago, my best friend and I came to this location for dinner. As well as to catch up. We walked in and the waiting area was over crowded of people waiting for a table. I walked up and put my name in, I was told it would be a 45 minute wait to sit inside. Agreeing, I looked around at the bar but there were only scattered empty seats. We waited aimlessly at the bar but it seemed no one wanted to move. My friend and I walked back to the waiting area where the hostess was trying to get people to eat outside in 50 degree weather. Even with heat lamps most turned her down. While I was waiting I almost slipped on their sticky floor twice and to be honest someone should have cleaned that. It's a hazard and if I would have fallen I would've be a happy campier. Still waiting for our table my friend and I could tell that the hostess was over worked and hadn't had a break. I truly felt sorry for her, you could tell she was overworked and needed someone to relieve her for a break. Finally, forty minutes later we were seated at a table. We waited five minutes which wasn't bad and a woman came to take our order for drinks. The waitress informed us that a gentleman would be taking over our table for her. The waiter came back with our drinks then we asked for a minute to order. As we still trying to make a decision with our order a couple gets seated two tables from us. The young man comes back and we order. Moments later he comes back with bread then leans across the table and starts discussing my friends tattoos. She was sweet enough to tell him then he kept staring at her. Just as he left, I saw the manager call him over and yell at him. Apparently, while he was flirting with my friend the couple two tables left in disgust. Now, I work in customer service myself and there is one thing you never do is yell at someone on the floor. Feeling a bit uncomfortable, I finish eating my bread and my friend stack our plates to let him know we're done with the bread. My friend asked for more so he went back for more. Out of the corner of my eye, I saw him come out of the kitchen with the bread. He drops a piece and kicks it to the side. Seriously? Come on! That's another hazard because someone could slip on it and fall. Our waiter comes back and give us back our dirty plates. No offense but he could have asked us if we wanted to use them before taking them or brought us new ones. Gross!! Thank goodness, our food finally comes and we start to finally enjoy. By the end of the end, I'm happy to get out of there. Never in my life have I experienced service so bad there. First of all that place needs more seating inside for cold days/nights such as that. Second, I thought the service was a bloody joke. I will not be returning to this location again.

Great location! The Stanford Mall is an outdoor mall with good restaurants and shops. We got to California Pizza Kitchen around 530pm on a Friday and luckily we got there the time that we did. Right at 6pm , people started to come in! Our waitress was a tad bit busy so we didn't get great service but it was good enough. I believe there was only 1 waitress for our section. We ordered the Original BBQ Pizza and my friend ordered a flat crust pizza (I forgot what it was called). The pizza was so good! Crust wasn't too thick and too thin to where you had to fold the pizza in half just to eat it. The bbq flavor wasn't overpowering to where it didn't taste like pizza anymore. It was so good I ate the whole thing! I can't wait to come back to try different dishes!

Can I up, lemme upgrade you!  I came in yesterday to share a Chinese Chicken Salad.  Just like last time, I got my food quick!  And the salad was just as tasty as it is at the full line CPK restaurants.  I just hope it's healthier than my second favorite, their Original BBQ Chicken Salad, or else, I'll cry!  =( Lesson learned: Chicken Noodle Soup..no, salads..yes!

The one at Stanford Mall is new, clean and modern. Service was great and I love thin crust pizza..and the Thai style is my favorite, I can't find this one in the freezer aisle ;P  They brought out my pizza a little on the 'toasty' side and It didn't really bother me but the manager said that they were going to bring me one to make up for the 'toastyness' I think they thought it was maybe burnt for their quality control who knows but I had a whole free pizza to go. score.   The salads are also pretty tasty (try the chopped Mediterranean its yummy.)  Lots of outdoor table, some with pop up umbrellas for shade, kid friendly...just know that it takes some time for the pizzas to bake so order a small appetizer if you have kiddies.

The food quality is consistent across the country. So, if I traveled to some place where no restaurants interested me, or if I am in the shopping mall in need of a quick but satisfying lunch, I would choose this restaurant for some Mushroom ravioli, I know it will always taste good. They also have a great selection. The service is always good.

First of all there was extreme confusion on the waiter's part about pizzas with gluten free crusts. Then he brings us dirty plates....twice. Our Cobb Salad came undressed. Our spinach dip was good. The pizza cane and it was cold. The texture of the crust was like styrofoam. The crust was still frozen. The bathroom after 30 minutes after opening was all out of toilet seat covers. Obviously won't be going back.

This is a California Pizza Kitchen ASAP. I'm not sure exactly what that means, but I can tell you the differences that I've observed. The biggest difference is that instead of being a sit-down restaurant where you're served by wait staff, they have you start by ordering at the counter. You're given a number that you leave on your table, and they'll find you and drop off your pizza. I guess that makes it ASAP? Dunno. Whatevs. Service has always been fine. My pizza has come out quickly, and people are friendly. As for the taste, California Pizza Kitchen is decent, but there's better pizza out there. What I do like about it, and what would be the only reason for me to go there, is their creativity with toppings and combinations that other pizza places don't typically do. I also like their honey-wheat whole-grain option for the crust. A couple of my favorite flavors are the pear and gorgonzola, and the white pizza with applewood bacon. The pear and gorgonzola is just delightful. The sweetness of the pairs is balanced with the sharpness of the gorgonzola cheese. I also do like these kinds of flavors, that just make your taste buds dance. The white pizza is a bit milder; it comes with sauteed garlic spinach along with five different types of cheese: mozzarella, fontina, parmesan, ricotta, and pecorino romano. I've never been one to protest several different types of cheeses, but as you can see, the cheeses are much milder than the gorgonzola on the other pizza! I like ordering this one with applewood bacon tossed on it; the saltiness of the bacon adds a bit more flavor to the pie. Those are a couple of my favorites, although in general, I tend to avoid California Pizza Kitchen. There are definitely better options from local pizza places.
I love this place - A list of my favorites:   Sedona Soup, Tri Colore Salad, Tequila Lime Fettuccini and the Chipotle Chicken Pizza. :D

More 2.5 star--SOLELY rated on FOOD, not service. Service deserves a 4-STAR!! Eh, I ordered the "works," and it was decent. I felt like the bell pepper could've sat in the oven for a bit longer. Not much on the pizza for calling it "the works." I probably won't come back again.  Next time, when i see "ASAP" CPK, i will pass, and move to a "real" CPK.  Nevertheless, service was great--quick and friendly=)
Great pizza! We enjoyed all our dishes. Very thin and crispy pizza, even better with the peach salad!

Apparently this used to be a more togo oriented operation.They just remodeled it with patio seating and a full on restaurant config. I originally wanted to sit outside as it was a nice day but the place was packed. GIven that there was a spot at the bar  I swooped in. Tons of folks behind the line and tons of wait staff buzzing through. There is something about watching the ops of a place with an open kitchen. Got a crazy caloric filled fried mac and cheese and then a four cheese pizza with bacon. It hit the spot and I was in and out in no time. Since the remodel they're firing on all cylinders and are heavily staffed to make sure things go well. Still have to return and sit out on the patio when the hoopla dies down a bit.

Worst service I've had in a while. I got water with ice when I asked for without, but that doesn't really matter.. What DOES matter is that there was a piece of food in my water... I didn't say anything and let it slide and ordered a pasta with absolutely NO cheese... I found cheese in the pasta and the server came back and told me i was wrong and "pinky promised" me that there was no cheese.. This kind of inconsiderate behavior bothers us vegans. The pasta had cheese in it. I asked for another plate and all the server did was try to convince me that I was wrong about the cheese. He was really annoying and I definitely will not be coming back here anytime soon...

We ordered a Sicilian pizza and a salad with two soft drinks. The food was good, it was just the service that justifies the poor review.  We arrived on a Saturday night and were seated immediately. Placed our order and the server asked if we wanted the salad first, we said yes. While we waited for our drinks a party of two in front of us, who arrived after, received their drink and complementary bread then appetizer before we got our drinks. The server was a different person, mind you. While we continued to wait, the server continuously approached an adjacent table but neglected to bring our drinks. Finally our drinks came, then a few minutes later our salad came then our pizza arrived within 1 minute. No fret though, as we were famished from a long Saturday. While we began to touch the salad the server approached us to ask how the food was--that was the last time we would interact with him until the check.  That brings me back to the adjacent table. The server continued to come back, and back, and back to them but neglected us. I had finished my soft drink quickly into our dinner but was not asked if I wanted a refill until we were asked if we wanted a dessert or boxes.  I did not confront the waiter as the adjacent table was a family of four with two young children and did not want to ruin their dinner when ours was already tarnished. I decided to write my frustration on the receipt.

Had the creamy garlic pasta tonight and my mom had the pesto, both with chicken... Delicious . Nice glass of wine and some bread.. Perfect! Cannot wait to go back and try one of their amazing looking pizzas or salads.

We go Stanford shopping center a lot w/ our dog and here is where we'd go for restaurant because they have outdoor sittings which allows dogs under table. This is a chain restaurant so food is as expected, no good no bad. It's just when you are wanting to eat w/ your dog buddy, come in and sit, finish, on leash and continue spend one of the brilliant days you together will have. Weekend is bit line here, 15mins tops for us (wife and me and dog for outdoor).

I typically love CPK and today in particular, I was craving it. I figured I would order it online and take it home via curbside after shopping. I've ordered a full size Waldorf Chicken 100x before, so I usually know what to expect. They gave it to me and I went on my way 35 miles away. Once I got home, I was MORTIFIED. There were 3, BITE SIZE pieces of chicken (maybe 2 in at best), about 7 pieces of apple, one blue cheese chunk and maybe about 10 grapes. I absolutely CANNOT BELIEVE I paid $16 plus a $2 tip for basically lettuce. I question whether they skimp on curbside folks because they can't complain in person. I know what this salad is normally supposed to be like and they obviously cut me WAY short. Shame on them. Total rip off.

Absolutely horrendous experience here. I already do not think very highly of this location, but I gave them the benefit of the doubt tonight. However, I did not think it was possible for a restaurant to give me so much anger, anxiety and frustration, but this location made it look easy. I wasted over an hour of my time at this location and going back and forth tonight. First off, my order took forever to be made. Then once it's ready to be consumed, they totally forgot two entrees. I had to waste another 20 minutes driving back to get the entrees that should have been included in the first place, especially given the ridiculous amount of time that was had in getting it to me correct. Outside of my own experience tonight, the takeout line was full of angry people, including a woman who was way overcharged for her order and had waited a ridiculously long time for it as well. At this point, I'm just going to avoid this location and only deal with other pizzerias around Palo Alto.
Should be renamed soup and salad kitchen. The pizzas on the menu are on a tiny foldout, no pictures of pizza anywhere. Zero stars.

Haven't been to CPK in 15 years and this place was crowded so I thought, how bad can it be? I was so wrong. Chinese chicken salad (1 star) - WORST EVER. They should be embarrassed that they serve this on the menu. It was a complete pile of mush. Horribly soggy lettuce with some wet sauce on top along with a few chunks of chicken. Felt like it was made a long time and that's why it was so soggy. Were they were known for this once?!? Pizza (3 stars) - dough and crust were fine with a crisp outside but chewy texture inside. But nothing to write home about. Service was very nice thankfully as the only saving grace. Bottom line: If this food is representative of all CPKs, I don't know how they stay in business.
Wonderful service! Kevin and Tino were so helpful when I came with two 89 year olds! Plus, the food was great. The Bianca flatbread with sage was delicious and even though a small plate, was a meal!

Came in around 5:20pm on a Friday afternoon. Our waitress was awesome, the food and drinks were quick, the only downfall was the lack of draft beer :((((. Other than that they have a full bar! I ordered a mediocre margarita and my favorite dish, the California club pizza, so good!  Minus a star for the lack of draft beer that was promised on the HQ website, everything else was delectable!

Order the Thai Crunch Salad w/o the avocado bc it's additional $2.50. And the Garlic Cream Fettucine with chicken is delicious. Take-out didn't take no more than 15 mins. Even at their busiest nights, customer service here is great! I "really" enjoy their food here... they have many good selections of salads, pastas, pizzas, & soups! This is comfort food for me, but with a healthy twist, especially when it comes to their salad choices. I always love coming to my favorite shopping center: Stanford Mall, so it was such a treat to be back & visit a bit, as I waited for my take-out, which wasn't a long wait at all. I would have dined-in & visited the mall longer, but I've had a long day at the office. Just needed comfort food & enjoy it at home in my pj's.  I will definitely be back here: Stanford Mall & CPK! Tip: my absolute favorite bakery is at this mall too! It's Cocola's!!! ;) I can't wait to see my old friend.

Really good ravioli! An info session review :D I had the food from the pizza kitchen at a college info session otherwise called a free food event. They had four cheese ravioli and kung pao spaghetti. The ravioli was really good and sufficiently cheesy and the flavor of the sauce was really good. I  wasn't a fan of the kung pao spaghetti though. I didn't like the idea of kung pao flavor with spaghetti.  There was also salad. Loved the dip.  I will probably go check this place out sometime , in person.

Stopped by the CPK at the Stanford Shopping Center after an appointment one afternoon. If you're ever in the mood for CPK, DON'T go to this one. It's not that clean. Our table felt sticky and it still smelled like the rags that they clean the table with. Yuck. Service was also meh. The one on Cowper is so much better since it's clean and there's more room to sit and breathe.  We also ordered some Spring Rolls for appetizers. Half were Thai Chicken (Peanut sauce, bean sprouts, scallions, carrots, cilantro and Mozzarella. Served with peanut sauce) and the other half were Mediterranean Veggie (Wild mushrooms, eggplant, sun-dried tomatoes, caramelized onions, Mozzarella and Parmesan. Served with marinara). Pictured above are the veggie ones, which I surprisingly preferred.  Anyway, I got the Spicy Chipotle Chicken Pizza and split it with two others. It has Chipotle adobo sauce, shaved poblanos, Monterey Jack with house-made roasted corn & black bean salsa, cilantro and lime crema. One of my favorites now on their menu since there's flavor and spice. I wish they still had the Tandoori chicken one like back in the day!

I had high hopes for California Pizza Kitchen at the Stanford Shopping Center.  After all, I like the frozen version of their pizza.  If a company can make a frozen pizza taste this good, then the fresh pizza should be great too, right? Wrong. Not only was the pizza slightly lower-quality than one would expect for a restaurant at this price point, but I think that the $5 frozen variety (with the same name) from Safeway actually tastes better. The restaurant looked nice.  However, it was extremely crowded.  As a result, the staff seemed a bit...frazzled...by the amount of people.  We were finally seated after 40 minutes.  We quickly ordered our food and drinks.  Yet, ironically, we had to wait another hour before we received our meal.  The irony was that our food was cold when it was served.  The waitress wasn't even apologetic.   Oddly enough, we discovered that we had been overcharged for our tab when we arrived home.  It seems like the waitress accidentally added someone else's set of drinks to our bill.  Go figure. For the price of our meal (about $50 with food, drinks and tip), we should have opted for a more trusted establishment.  The next time that we are visiting the Stanford Shopping Center, we'll probably eat at THE MELT.  It is much less expensive and the food is better.

My fiance had never been to a California Pizza Kitchen, despite LOVING pizza and living in California, so we came here after some wedding registry action in the Stanford Shopping Center, and we had a really delicious meal! The menu could use some more vegetarian options, but we found some things we wanted to try.  We got the wild mushroom pizza on their whole wheat crust (killer!!) and the caramelized peach salad subbing out bleu cheese for goat cheese.  Also killer.  We finished everything and the bill was completely reasonable. They also offer a deal for two people eating together: an appetizer, two entrees, and dessert for $30.  You have to be hungry, but it sounds like you'd get your money's worth! We'd like to come back... Especially if they get more vegetarian options on their menu!  Isn't vegetarianism very Californian....?
Loved John on the patio!! Highly recommend his section for an afternoon lunch. John was so, so nice to us and we enjoyed our pizza!
Great customer service. I've been going there for 3 years and always happy with the food and the service.  Very busy during lunch time but I always find an empty chair in the bar area.
food is ok. service is good. thank you to our server Charissa/Charisse. not sure, can't really tell the last letters of her name.

A cheaper sit down place to eat in this mall. There isn't anything special about this place. Your typical California Pizza Kitchen. We should have walked around before we decided on what to eat because there are a lot of interesting affordable places to eat besides California Pizza Kitchen.  We arrived shortly after they opened and was given a 2 person booth indoors. We ordered: Caramelized Peach Salad with Bacon (Field greens, spinach, warm caramelized peaches, cranberries, red onions, toasted pecans and Gorgonzola tossed in housemade white balsamic vinaigrette.) - This wasn't bad but not amazing. There wasn't that many pieces of peaches, bacon, or cheese. =/  The Works Pizza - I like that it is thin. It was a pretty good pizza.  Overall, we had a good experience but if you are out there go to this little cafe's or the grocery store for lunch. Cheaper and more unique experience. As a sit down place this is probably a good place to eat.  Clean bathrooms.

+ Pizza recommendations:  1) Habanero Carnitas (served with a super pink, super spicy habanero sauce). I actually preferred the pizza without adding the sauce because it was so spicy and had me chugging water. Really wish I had more pain tolerance because it was very tasty!  2) Mushroom Pepperoni Sausage 3) Sicilian (thin crust) 4) Meat cravers (thin crust) I've tried the Original BBQ pizza as well, but I've learned I'm not a big sweet pizza person (aside from Hawaiian, maybe), so I wouldn't choose it over these 4. I also did prefer the original pizzas to their thin crust pizzas -- personal preference though.   + Waldorf salad: I'm biased here because this is one of my favorite types of salads, but it was really good! I do wish the "full salad" portion were bigger -- I came with a group of 3 and we definitely could have had more.  + Portion sizes: I came in a group of 3 hungry people and we ordered 2 pizzas and a salad.  - Wait time: It's usually long without a reservation, so I'd make one if possible. Both times I've come so far for dinner, the wait has probably been around 20-30 minutes. Service is also unfortunately pretty slow, but thankfully they do serve a bread plate to get you started. Ask for it if your server doesn't bring it! One time (when we were particularly hungry :P), the server brought it with our meal, so my guess is he might have forgotten...

My girlfriend and I frequent this eatery.  Last time my husband joined us.  Everything was alright up and till the bill came.  The waiter took the bill and cash and never returned.  He avoided eye contact with us.  I guess he felt that the change was his tip.  Actually I was going to leave him more.  (Both my husband and I have worked in restaurants in the past.)  But we were in a hurry to get to the doctor's office so I just left matters as the stood.  But I am going to have to find another restaurant to eat at on my frequent visits to Stanford.

Pretty delicious place! & the air condition is most certainly a plus! I thought I had the best spinach artichoke dip ever at Elephant Bar, but I was surely wrong! This location has wonderful outdoor seating as well & our waiter was the sweetest! I will most certainly come back.

It's hard to find good service at these types of restaurants nowadays.  Came here for dinner and was seated instantly if you are ok with sitting outside and with the sun shining on you.  The outside is more accommodating for strollers and children and my son can people watch.  Our nice server came by, took our orders for drinks immediately, returning with our drinks in 3 minutes. Wow...efficient!  He even informed us that our pizzas would be out shortly after waiting around for food for another 20 minutes....yeah that shortly became 10 minutes.  But we understood that the poor guy was waiting on tables outside and inside the restaurant.  Once our food came, I looked at our "full-sized" cobb salad and wondered, wow...that's one small "full" sized salad..so we had to ask the waiter...He confirmed what we ordered and realized that he mistakenly told the kitchen to prepare a Half size salad...so he immediately placed the other half and only charged us for a half-size salad ($3-4 difference). The salad was full of substance, even with the red beets.  As for our pizzas, I would not recommend the pear and gorgonzola pizza because it didn't taste nor look right...The margherita and sicilian pizzas were phenomenal.  I would come back here anyday.

I had a huge craving for pizza and the group of friends I was with wanted pizza as well so we came here. It gets a little packed. It was a 20min wait to eat inside. We decided to opt out to eat outside. They have no 5 seaters or 6 seaters. Therefore they just added a 5th chair to a 4 seater table. The service was okay. They are for sure understaffed. Our waiter always brought us what we asked (more bread, water, refills, etc.) but he just took a long time to get it to us because he was so busy attending other tables as well. He was really nice though. The food was overall pretty decent. I had the margherita pizza.

When we first arrived, it was freezing. We asked to have the AC lower, and asked again and again and again . At the end of our meal, we were freezing despite wearing jackets, in July!! 5 min after being served, our waiter asked if we were done and we needed boxes to take leftovers! And she came back twice during our meal to ask the same question! Then, while eating, we received the check although we didn't requested it yet! I would never go back to this restaurant! So unwelcoming!
Goods Real good personnel pizza. My fav is veggie pizza choices of gluten free crust available and even honey wheat crust. Gourmet  salads choices  Cons Portions are smaller

Wonderful here-- at night, it's so beautiful looking out the window at all the christmas lights on the trees....STILL on the trees!  Ordered the 4cheese+tomato pizza, split between two people is perfect.  Easy to finish, and easy to feel satisfied.  The crust was slightly sweet, which is great, so it doesn't feel like you're OD-ing on salt... perfection in a moderately sized circle topped with melted cheese and yes that is the amazing goodness of PIZZA!~~~

Pizza is probably one thing that I never, ever crave.  Seriously - no amount of chili flakes could elevate a humble pizza from its "emergency-food-to-be-eaten-in-front-of-computer-during-the-week-leading-up-to-Form-10K-filing" status to something else. So it goes without saying that I never would go to CPK, let alone CPK ASAP by choice.  And if I go, I would not look at their pizza selections.  I find pizza so repulsive such that I found myself ordering the lesser of two evils, being a thai chicken salad.  Side note: I am almost an anti-vegetarian and my daily fruit and vegetable intake is laughable. So I was pleasantly surprised when the salad was delicious.  Yes, yes, romaine lettuce has hardly any nutritional value.  What's more, the salad was laden with bits of chicken breasts, salad dressing which probably has a ton of sugar in it, deep-fried crispy wonton bits, thereby reversing whatever little nutritional value contained within the romaine lettuce.  But I don't care.  It was delicious, and I was feeling proud of myself for at least eating semi-'healthily'

Arrived at Stanford Shopping Center at 11:30 on a Saturday, but needed to get something to eat before shopping. Max's would have been too long, and portions would have been too big.  So we came in here. I've been in CPK restaurants numerous times, but never have stepped into an ASAP. You order at the cash register, get a number, find a table, and you order is served to you. Menu is not as extensive as the restaurants, so there's no appetizers, entrees, and desserts. But there are soups, salads, pizzas, pastas, and kid's menu items. Also they have 14" pizzas, large enough to share.  Kids had fusilli with alfredo sauce, wife had a Thai chicken pizza, and I had chicken panini. Food came pretty quickly. Good and consistent as the restaurants, only that we were in and out of this place within a half hour.  Good alternative for lunch, especially after they closed Oakville Grocery.

For a quick lunch at the Stanford Shopping Center, I highly recommend California Pizza Kitchen (affectionately nicknamed CPK). They make the perfect salads for a shopping excursion (or any time actually!). In my opinion, it's best not to have a huge meal while shopping because you may lose stamina and/or feel fat in every article you try on. Their asian-style salads are amazing though! When I do want pizza, I usually opt for the thai chicken pizza because it's delicious! Woo-hoo, CPK!

30 minutes on the waiting list with 3 people on the desk. But 4 empty tables without reservation... They were lucky my wife insisted to eat here and that the iPhone offers so many entertainment. I'd be gone asap.

We were 3 diners ordering salad and sandwich lunches. 2 out of 3 lunches came out at within a reasonable amount of time. The 3rd lunch came out 25 minutes later. What's the big deal? Well, to the person waiting for the food and the diners going ahead and eating it was plain awkward. I did ask our waitperson to comp the third lunch. Next thing we know the VERY aggressive "General Manager," was in our faces, angrily asking "what happened?" After my explanation, he said "ok," and walked away. A while later the bill appeared with the entree taken off. All in all, an unpleasant meal.
Though it may be a bit pricey for pizza... It still is yummy!! I can't get enough of that BBQ chicken pizza!  Service was great. Anyone that asks if I need extra ranch gets a thumbs up!!

Met up with a friend here after work. We weren't in much of an eating mood, but I was in need of something to warm me up, so we headed in here and I got their tomato soup and we shared the spinach artichoke dip. The soup was salty and thick, but didn't taste very much like tomato (for a good bowl of tomato soup in the mall, hit up La Baguette). The spinach artichoke dip was okay...if you don't mind seeing the layer of oil at the top. I've been to CPK in PA and have ordered their pizzas and salads which were pretty good. So the low rating is based on their soup and appetizer dish we had. Service was standard, nothing exceptional.

CPK ASAP is a good choice if you're in need of food while shopping  or coming from Stanford.  This location differs from CPK in that it is a fast food style set up:  Order, grab a table, server brings food or calls you name if you're taking out.   I have always liked their BBQ Chicken Pizza, even though the BBQ sauce is a bit too salty for me.  The crust is thin & crispy.  They also serve pastas, salads and sanwiches.  I ordered the tequila lime chicken pasta which was really yummy with spinach fettuccine, cream sauce and tequila lime marinated chicken.  For a salad, I ordered the chinese chicken, which was also great with fried wonton pieces, chicken and a tangy & sweet dressing.   If you're in a hurry there are certain items (mostly salads & sandwiches) marked on the menu that are pre-made.  You can go to the refrigerator case and pick up without having to wait for an order to come out of the kitchen.  Otherwise, I don't think the name suits it for ordered items, it took about 20 mins, not ASAP!!   I will definately continue to come here when I'm in the area.  Everything I ordered was good and I would recommend others to try them.  Overall, 3.5 stars.

Well, it's of course a chain...but, the food is good.  Pizza's are well-made, salads are "clean" and tasty...solid appetizers...beer and mixed drinks.  Big plus for being nice, but casual and noisy enough to take the kiddies.

3.5 stars - Quiet for late Thursday dinner.   Service attentive, food good:  chipotle pizza and tiramisu desert.  Pizza a bit too salty for my pallet.  Cozy place for 2, includes a full bar on site, and take out.

It was a beautiful Saturday afternoon, and we were off to Stanford mall to avoid the hectic hell that probably was at Valley Fair.  After some suit shopping, we ended up at California Pizza Kitchen ASAP since it seemed right up our alley:  a place where you order up at the counter, and they bring out the food to you.   I got a half Caesar salad and half turkey club combo.  The Caesar had real Parmesan shavings and nothing much else to it.  The turkey club was pretty tasty and the focaccia bread actually tasted fresh, and had some substance to it.  Overall good place to grab lunch while at Stanford mall; especially if you don't want to spend an arm and a leg and risk a long wait at Max's.

I work across the street (well, across the mall then the street, but whatever) and as much as I like the walk and milling about waiting for my food (yes, I could call first), I am not that impressed with this particular location Don't get me wrong, love CPK's food and the selection has gotten better then when it first opened This location is a nightmare The Take Out line seems to be one door and then there is a 'main' door where you can order and sit or order and leave...which leads one to think, where do you stand, sit, mill, etc. for your order?  Its a bit confusing and congested and not well thought out First time, got a half salad and some soup, wait time, 12 minutes Second time, since I loved the salad so much, got a full salad and some soup...wait time?  25 minutes.  Really?  Not so sure about the ASAP portion of the program.   So I mentioned it to the manager, said, "Does it normally take this long for an order?"  He said no, and asked if there was something he could do for me, I shrugged and shook my head and walked out Third time, today...disaster.  I think the manager remembered me because when I left my order and walked to Williams Sonoma to check out the new Thomas Keller Ad Hoc product line, my salad and soup was already ready.   Huh...ok, cool, like that.  So I walked back to my office and my order was WRONG So yeah, in an effort to impress with their speedy delivery, they failed on quality control and didn't get the order correct If I go back I will call...if I am not in a hurry and just want to relax and sit and enjoy the scenery, I will walk there.

I have had lunch here twice. The food is okay, nothing to rave about. My friend was raving about the red velvet cake...she got herself one and one for me. It was big...big enough for us to just have ordered one. Oh well, I took the rest of mine home for later. I was informed by the cashier that the ASAP location has some menu items that are not on the regular CPK menu. Interesting. The chicken salad I ordered had more dressing than I would have liked, but the avocado in it was fresh and good.
Excellent service! The staff were super friendly! The pizza was okay, not so impressive. My Kong Pao noodle was yummy. A little bit too spicy for my taste but it's Kong Pao style!
I tried wild mushroom pizza and really liked it. The dough was great and the toppings were yummy.

A group of 6 of us came in for lunch while waiting for our family member to undergo an operation nearby at Stanford Hospital. The manager found out why we were they and before the meal was over brought us a get well card signed by the entire staff. I have no idea how they found out but the gesture was amazing. The food was excellent, I had the crispy chicken sandwich and would recommend the avocado egg rolls. The BBQ classic chicken pizza is always a 10. Just want to thank the manager and staff for giving us a bright spot in an otherwise tough day.

The servers tonight seemed a little out of it/distracted tonight. They kept forgetting simple details, never came by to check up to see if we liked our food, had to get up about 3 times to ask for utensils, drink refills, and to put in an order for another appetizer. I mean they were nice just didn't seem like the guests needs were #1 tonight....besides that food was great on point as always had the buffalo caauliflower, Szechwan dumplings, and a cup of the tortilla soup. maybe il have better luck another time with the service
Nice people working here, all the standard California Pizza Kitchen foods, menu recently updated- has some nice things. Enjoyable!

Been going here regularly because my children love the cheese pizza. Last time our cheese pizza was burned (black spots all over the pizza). Finally got fed up during another visit with the attitude from the host/hostess stand. Phoned in our order while driving for takeout order. Got there within 5 minutes at the most, asked if it would be alright to eat in instead. The host and hostess (2 people) replied "No, absolutely not." No reason given, no apology, just a very curt 3 word reply. Really? We were there early afternoon on a Sunday, plenty of tables available and our order was not ready for another 20 minutes. Bye Bye CPK, you lost a customer, not going here again! Plenty of other dining options close by.

We stopped by after some shopping for a quick bite, place looked half empty, but hostess said it is 20 min wait. After I pointed out that half of the tables are empty, she said they are not been cleaned yet. So, I asked for the table outside, because surely I can see that at least 10 tables are available, she sent another hostess to check, that guy just disappointed. After waiting another 10 min, we finally got table outside. The tables inside still were not cleaned while 3 more hostesses were standing , doing nothing.  Looked incompetent.  Our waiter was great! Very courageous, welcoming, accommodative. The food was coming fast enough and was not bad at all.
Food wasn't as we expected; portions seemed smaller than at other locations. Service was extremely slow. Will not be returning to this location again.
Pizza was dry and tasteless. Pasta was dry too. So disappointed for such a pricey place. Not going back.

I was super excited to try CPK as a newcomer to the area, as it was recommended by friends. I was mildly disappointed. The service was slow every time, and a couple of times it was outright dismissive. The food was decently proportioned, but the quality does not match the price. :/ It looks like they've been improving recently, and I hope that trend continues!

"this is the worst club sandwich i've ever had" - my friend who orders a club sandwich almost everywhere i got the quinoa and arugula salad. going in, i hate arugula but almost every other option wasn't vegetarian or didn't sound good, so i figured whatever i'll give arugula another try. bad choice. let's forget i hate arugula for a moment, because that's not even why my salad was nastier than a mayo infested potato salad at the end of a bbq. the asparagus in my salad was cooked but a bit mushy, they had way too many onions, and whatever dressing used was less flavorful than the playdough i ate as a toddler. my friend also got the potato soup which honestly tasted like it was out of a plastic package and like the amount of cream was supposed to make up for the lack of actual flavor. food sucks but the people who worked there were all very nice. i also appreciate how dog friendly they are.

Jambalaya pasta blew me away. I hate pizza and was dreading to come here but I was so impressed with their pasta and caramelized peach salad... Cant wait to be back! Second time coming: Tried something new, their chicken tequila pasta, I forgot the full name but it was yummers! And my friend got their Hawaiian pizza  and it was really good too! I always sit outside and service has been pretty good.

We've been coming regularly for several years, and the food and service have consistently been good.  Back when my mom was still with us, they were patient and respectful of her specific requests.  They've also accommodated our requests for well-cooked pasta (the boy doesn't like his noodles Al dente).  On Sunday's, they can get pretty busy, and the wait can be long.  Come early, or on a weekday.  Good stuff.

Good chain restaurant in a busy shopping area. The food is reliable (the thin crust pizzas are the best things on the menu with the Tostada pizza and the pear & gorgonzola pizza among my favorites). The service is also decent. The restaurant is small but the outside seating area allows for more options.

CPK is CPK. Wherever one goes.  This location is pretty consistently busy, often with a moderate wait.  The food is CPK. Solid, fancier style pizzas, good salads.  We often get one pizza and one salad and share them between my husband and I.  Our usuals (if you can call it that - we come here about once ever six months) are: The white pizza with added bacon - I think the bacon makes the pizza. Don't neglect it if you order the white pizza!  The Thai Crunch salad with avocado instead of chicken. Again, the rich, buttery avocado really makes the salad for me.  Everything I've had here is consistent and good, and the service is good too. I struggle with giving it any higher than 3 stars because I can't say "yay I'm a fan." But I do enjoy this place now and again, so I'm going for the full 4 stars.

This location is fairly small so we ended up ordering food to go since it was already after 7 p.m. and we didn't want to wait 20 minutes for a table. The food came out very quickly (only 15 minutes). Everything tasted good, just as we expected. We've eaten at this location twice before and most of the time we call in an order for curbside pick up or we door dash if we absolutely don't want to leave the house.
The saving grace is the flat bread,  it is like two pieces of pizza.  The soup is like bean paste!

Always love the food here! Good, simpleish menu with lots of good variety for pizza, pasta, and salad. Always a long wait at dinner time though and not very fast to seat you. We love coming here after being at the mall all afternoon!
Updated for eating a Medal Screw inside the pizza on 11/28/2014. I have done a root canal and permanent Crown on the Tooth #3.  Suffered for almost two years to get uses to eating with a crown.

0 star for customer service. Negative rating if I can! I am a long-time CPK patron and our family loves coming to CPK. On 4/12/15, however, we had the most unpleasant experience with CPK stanford of my life.  We arrived at the CPK at 1:30 and was told to put down our names and the wait time would be 15 mins. We sat by the front desk and waited patiently. At 2:10, I saw parties that arrived much much later than us were getting seated and went to the front desk and asked about our table.  The girl calling the parties misspelled our name, but never called  even the misspelled name, and skipped our table. So 15 parties after us got seated, and we were still sitting next to her waiting to be called.  This girl with heavy eye makeup offered no apology whatsoever, and when the server (manager?) came to lead us to our table, she immediately started bad mouthing us in front of her coworker and other customers loudly--to the point that I can hear her calling us out!!! This is the most disgusting experience I have ever had in any restaurant, including fast food chains. CPK stanford -- your customer service training is appallingly inadequate, and your front desk staff needs an attitude adjustment. I don't believe I have the appetite to return to CPK ever again.  I had some good times at CPK, but won't miss them. When I see the palm tree logo of yours, all I can think of is that you hire people who are mean, rude, and unapologetic. Too bad. All you need is one bad experience to cut out a restaurant from your life.
Really?  We had a party of 17 people and you are going to tell me that we can only split the check once because you are lazy.  Not coming back.

I'm sad to say that I can't recommend this place anymore. It's been my experience - on several occasions - that CPK doesn't open on time. Instead of 11 it's 11-ish. But maybe a few minutes late, despite seeing the line forming outside. However, today I left. I walked away. It was cold. We'd been waiting almost 10 minutes after 11. And they were just standing inside. Taking pictures of each other. While looking outside at us rubes standing and waiting for them to open the door. So, I left. I went next store to Yucca (which has a nice GF menu BTW). I will not frequent CPK again. If they have this much visible disdain for their customers, I shudder to think about what they do when we can't see what they really think of us. (p.s. I'm going to send this message to corporate. I hope whomever made the decision to take selfies rather than take care of customers might learn a bit of a lesson. But maybe not.)

I was very disappointed with this branch.  I am a fan of CPK, and the one I normally go to is the branch at the Valley Fair mall.  I figured it would be the same.  Wrong! I went on a weekday for dinner.  It was not too busy and maybe they were under staffed?  Our food came out really late.  Just to order a pizza and entree took 50 minutes.  Even the waitress saw that we have been waiting for a while and she apologized for it.  She was the only thing good about this restaurant.  When we got our food, both the pizza and pasta were luke warm.  How is that possible after waiting for so long?  Was it just sitting there and they just forgot to serve the food to us?  I saw other tables that came after me getting their food before we did, and they too ordered a pizza.  Well, I don't know if I'd come back to this branch again with this type of food and late service.

I ordered take-out, a margueritta pizza, and it just wasn't good. In fact, it was among the worst pizzas I've had.. It tastes much worse than comparable pizza chains like Pizza Hut or Donino's, which are much much better. If you're into fast food chains, you might think this place is all-right, but even in the world of fast food chains, I would rate this very low. I wouldn't recommend going here, the pizza has such a ready-made taste, and I personally found it difficult to stomach.

The roasted artichoke and spinach pizza with chicken on thin crust was awesome! The server was really friendly and I don't think I actually saw the bottom of my water glass once throughout the course of the meal. I'd definitely recommend coming here for lunch or dinner.

2.5 stars. ASAP my ass. Took us more than half an hour for our Thai salad, which was soggy but flavorful. Not worth the $7.99 price tag. The 14" Thai chicken pizza for $14.99 was worth it though. My friend and I each had 3 slices and that came out quickly. My complaint was that it was slighly undercooked, I like the crust somewhat crispy. Someone mentioned that their pastas were good. Maybe it is, but I don't plan on returning unless I am craving Thai chicken pizza. Peace out.

we were able to get in right at closing time.  we were a party of 7 and they were still able to seat us and get our order right.  the pizzas were good, nothing extraordinary.  the pastas looked good too but again, nothing extraordinary.

This is one of my favorite restaurants ever, and one that I visit frequently. BBQ chicken salad, dynamite shrimp, and the mac and cheese (childish but hey, it's tasty) are among my favorites. The cheesecake is also good, but the best dessert ever was the sticky toffee pudding, which was taken off the menu, much to everyone's surprise. But the atmosphere is great and the people are nice, which makes a huge difference.

At any CPK, I always order the tomato basil spaghettini with grilled chicken. This place has got to be the worst I've tasted. The spaghettini was good, correctly cooked and seasoned however the grilled chicken-omg, the chicken was so salty. I couldn't even mask the salt when I combined it with the spaghetti in one mouthful.  As for the service, the waitress didn't come by our table once in between the time she gave us our check and the times she came to get our orders and give us our drinks.  Lastly, the cherry limeade I ordered was way too sweet. I've never had it before but I'm pretty sure something like what I had isn't supposed to be on the menu. Either everyone in Palo Alto likes their food overly salted and overly sugared or the chef/bartender here has too heavy of a hand with the seaoning. I'm thinking it's the latter.

Mixed experiences here with service but the food is always good.  Serve your own drinks, grab extra napkins...  For Kids:  The kid's meal portions are huge and includes a drink.   Even the kids pizza is a good size.  If you are a member of the kid's club at the mall, you get a free kids meal with an adult entree.  Easy going place with lots of other kids.

Not someplace to crave, but a convenient, relatively cheap and decent option for when you need to eat at the mall. Service is overall great and attentive, and food comes out ASAP. I've tried the Asian chicken salad, Meat Cravers and The Works pizzas, club panini, and they're all just OK. The table next to us ordered the spaghetti and it looked pretty appetizing. Will have to try that next time.

Running an errand at the apple store today...in PA "I'm hungry".....ooooh! CPK is around the corner! Pesto Chicken Salad Sandwich and a baby bottle of Chardonnay. The sandwich was wrapped in pita bread which is a total 4 star for me b/c it has less calories than normal bread. YUM! I'm bummed because I left the other half of my sandwhich in the Macy's dressing room. Those damn Hudson jeans distracted me...

The food here was so satisfying.  Went here when I was starving and they beought out the avacado egg rolls promptly and it was delicious.  The Sicilian Pizza was so tasty. My bf and I recieved great service from the servers and food runners. Definitely will be returning.

I was very anti CPK for a long time. I think I just had a bad experience when younger and never went back but I was missing out. I recently went with my father and had a really great pizza. It was a different kind of pizza than I ever had before and the wait staff was very nice and have great service! I can't wait to go back and try the pizza again!

Ordering service was slow... the cashier was on his cell phone having a personal conversation, and we just stood there watching him, as he made no acknowledgment of our existence. finally another lady came by and said "he'll be right with us"  Mushroom pepperoni sausage pizza - way better in the restaurant than frozen!  Chopped salad (and we specified no chopped garbanzo beans) and it came out with GB... after mentioning it, they quickly rectified the situation.  the food is good, quick and fast. so if you're in the mall shopping around and want a quick bite that won't give you a food coma, come on in!  (If you're hoping to come and hang out with the girlfriends, especially later in the evening... they will clean all around you and make it known, that they want you out)
We have eaten here twice and the food has always been good. Our waiter was pleasant and attentive. Definitely a place I would come back to.

VERY upset. Last two times I've ordered the chipotle chicken pizza and they ran out of the salsa that is normally served with it. So basically gave me half my order. You couldn't tell me before I ordered my pizza?
Good for kids - they give a coloring sheet with crayons, pasta comes in a bowl (vs plate) that's easy for kids to eat from.

I ate here recently with a girlfriend. The restaurant was crowded but we sat ourselves at the counter so we didn't have to wait for a table to open up.  We were looking for something light so we ordered the hummus appetizer and soup. I noticed that we didn't get any bread & butter but since I didn't want the carbs anyway, I didn't ask for it.  The hummus appetizer was tasty. The bread was nice and warm--that was a plus. I ordered the Chicken Tortilla Soup. It was a lot thicker/creamier than I expected. Usually when I've had this soup at other restaurants, the broth is clear with bits of chicken, corn, avacodo and crispy tortilla strips. This version was a little heavy. Had I known, I would have ordered a salad. I normally order the BBQ chicken salad here and I love it. The pizzas are generally pretty tasty too.  Service was fine. Our server was friendly and efficient. CPK is what you'd expect to get at the mall -- maybe a little better.
Service is inconsistent. Nothing special at all. The food is ok, service  needs more personalized attention to the customers.

This is my go to when I'm tired of eating the usual food at my work.  I love the soup and sandwich combo. The tortilla soup is yummy! BBQ chicken salad or the BBQ chicken pizza is good as well. The service is always friendly and they are pretty quick hence the name ASAP! If they weren't they have some essplaining to do!

My 8 year old loves the Mac & Cheese (but it has had too much sauce on occasion) and my daughter really likes the pesto creme penne with chicken.  Most locations have bread and butter, but you need to ask for it.  My husband and I usually share a Sicilian pizza, it's one of their thin pizzas with spicy marinara sauce, sausage, spicy capicola ham, salami, and mozzarella cheese.  It's pretty flavorful if you shake on parmesan cheese and peppers.  If we come here too many times, we'll get the blt or greek pizza with avocados.  The pizza is only enough for one, so we usually order a pasta dish to go with it.  The four cheese raviolis were kind of plain.  We order the pesto creme penne without chicken. We don't think the chicken tastes fresh, it's like the chicken they put on your pizza.  The salads are chopped too much for us.  We will get a small plate like guacamole and chips if we're really hungry.  We tried most of the appetizers at one time, but we like  the appetizers at Cheesecake factory better.  The kids may get a ice cream sundae with m & m's and we like the butter cake with ice cream and whip cream.  It's a small cake that has a harder outside crust with sugar and it's buttery tasting in the middle which goes good with ice cream. Our kids really like CPK. We've gone to the cpk's in Anaheim, Honolulu, Las Vegas, San Jose, Palo Alto, and Hillsdale,   It's pricey for pizza and pasta. but it's clean and relaxing.  Servers are usually young and professional.

I've been having lunch here on and off for about 2 years. Its really the only fast and reasonably priced place to eat at the mall that isn't fast food and has indoor seating. I wish the mall had more food options. That aside, I have slowly, over the past years, changed from indifference to a fan as their menu has expanded. I don't always want a pizza for lunch, I like healthy options, and their pizza in my opinion is good but not great. But I like their salads, and their turkey sandwich is really nice: hearty, fresh, and you can get it to go in a pre-pack. But the real special secret on the menu is the split pea soup. Yum! Comes with a roll, and I believe its vegetarian. On cold days this is perfect. A decent portion, very healthy. Yesterday I tried the pasta bolognese. I dread having pasta with a sweet tasting sauce, and this was great. It was hearty, al dente, and though it could have used a bit more meat, I thought it was very good. If I could change one thing about CPK it would be to have more diet soda options on the fountain. A diet sprite or lemonade would make me happy. I get tired of water, I don't drink caffeine and I don't want 300 calories worth of soda. And they definitely need to increase the seating here somehow outdoors if they can. Otherwise everyone spends time playing table vulture at lunch, hovering near people who look like they're finishing and swooping off before the table is cleared.
This place takes forever. Not ASAP at all. Don't go here if you're in a hurry. If you are in a hurry, call ahead. However, the chicken salad sandwich in the to-go fridge is pretty good.

Does ASAP stand for As Slow As Possible? The wait on take out here is ridiculous. My girlfriend and I stopped here to grab a pizza one afternoon. Granted it was around lunch and they were very busy, but the boy in front of us was done with his meal at least 10 minutes before we even got our little personal pizzas. Call ahead, or don't even bother. The pizza's okay, but not really worth the wait.

CPK have always been my favorite pizza place no doubt about it, but this locatuon wasnt the best at all. I got a sierra mist drink from their soda machine and realized the drink was watered down. So i told one of the guys who works there, about the problem and that guy just shrugged me off. He acted like he didnt hear me at all. Most restuarants have the best food they could possibly have and unfortunately they have the worse customer service along with it.
Why is it called ASAP? Cuz I the pizza here is coming out very slow. It took me about 30 minutes to get my order. It wasn't also a busy day but a slow day.

I'm usually a regular here especially when I come for lunch. I work in Bloomingdales and today by far has been the greatest service I've had. Greg was especially amazing with my service. Will be coming more often for lunch.

Turkey Club Panini - Why did my sandwich come out WARM? This thing is supposed to be hot. I expected my cheese to be melted. It looked like it was sitting out for five minutes before it was served. Other than that, it was tasty. This place offers premade salads and sandwiches that are perfect for those that are in a hurry. Good variety of pizzas. Soups, appetizers, dessert and a menu for kids. Can't expect too much from mall food!

I have to cater a lot so I find their curbside service very convenient. Not having to find parking and walking to the restaurant is great!  HOWEVER! I would expect CPK ASAP to have faster curbside service than the regular CPK in San Mateo at the Hillsdale mall. The San Mateo store takes my credit card info ahead of time so that they can make one trip to my car with the food and check to sign. I offered my credit card number to the ASAP store and they said they'd get it from me when I arrived, thus having to make 2 separate trips. Food tastes great though! I like how they have started to offer pasta at this location. I loved the portabello mushroom ravioli with cream sauce.

California Pizza Kitchen is good. The employees there were so nice to me and helpful. My mom and I were there looking at the menu and one of the employees smiled at us and ask if we need help on what pizzas are recommended and which ones are his favorite. My mom asked him which salad is his favorite and he answered very politely. The food in general was okay my veggie pizza was sort of bland and tasteless but the the salad my mom had was delish.

From past experiences, I recall this franchise's pizza are okay, still somehow like Round Table's better. For this location, though, I enjoy how I can get a plate of ravioli along with a side soup for lunch during shopping visits down here. I had their Tuscan white bean minestrone soup yesterday, and it was quite nice (different from other regular minestrone I've had and enjoyed). I tried their cheese ravioli yesterday, but most likely I'll order the portobello mushroom one instead which I enjoyed in the past.

this place looks like a mcdonalds when you walk in haha. good thing about cpk asap is that you don't have to flag your waiter down for refills or to order more...it's basically self serve. another good thing is that the prices are cheaper. yay to self serve fountain drink machine! the complimentary bread almost broke my tooth. it was so hard!! what i always order: chicken tequila fettuccine thai salad turkey club sandwich YUM YUM YUM!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

I come here during my hour lunch breaks when I am working eight hour shifts. For being a quick fast food California Pizza Kitchen, I am impressed. Their soup and salad option is really helpful, so you could try the best of both items! The food is not even pricey and they give you a good amount. I always get the Original BBQ Chicken Chopped Salad. What I also like here is the Pesto Creme Penne pasta. The food is pretty filling and helps me feel motivated to get back to working. The service is pretty quick as well and there is enough time to take a break from shopping and have a quick fix meal.

Went here with my family for pizza and pasta after shopping today. The food in this CPK is consistently good, never disappoint. We frequently go here when shopping at Stanford. Today we ordered:  - Small 9" Cheese pizza (the edges were kinda burnt) - Kids BBQ Chicken pizza (this was perfect!) - Spaghetti with tomato basil (very good!) Their kids meals are reasonably priced and comes with a drink choice of soda or milk.  Giving this 4-stars since my kids weren't given the coloring sheet/colors even if we ordered kids meals.

I usually enjoy this chain, but we had a terrible experience at this location. My daughter & I went in on a Wednesday evening for dinner. We stood in line behind a couple. After 5 minutes they asked the cashier if he was ready. He replied that he was ready and hadn't been paying attention. The lady vented for a minute about not waiting in line for her health. When we finally got our turn, he was not listening to me order and asked me to repeat it twice... all I was getting was a kids cheese pizza... how hard is that? When we sat down, we realized the guy didn't give us my kids top and straw for her drink. We received the pizza within a few minutes, and my daughter enjoyed her meal. Decent/Good Food... BAD SERVICE!!!

1 p.m. , line out the door to order.   We sat outside, had our hot pizzas within 15 minutes.  A little skimpy on the toppings on one pizza, but otherwise very good (almost as good as regular CPK).  Decent lunch for good price.

I never really liked CPK before, but I grew very fond to their sandwiches. The turkey club panini is my favorite. It has the perfect crunch and texture to it and it comes with a side of apple cider slaw and while I have never liked coleslaw, this is my exception. In the lame words of Rachel Ray: YUM-O. The Sedona Tortilla soup ain't too shabby either. It's kinda reminiscent of Doritos. haha Gross, I know, but it's pretty good. The location is pretty good too since it plays as an alternative to some of the eateries in the shopping center.

Seriously, don't let the 'ASAP' part fool you. The food tastes about the same as the regular one and it doesn't come out as quick as you think it would, according to the name of this place. I love CPK's Raspberry Iced Tea--but they don't have it here! =[

I'm a fan of the tortilla soup and the pesto chicken sandwich.. Why you might ask? Because I work right around the corner and you can call in an order, swoop in to the togo side of the counter and pick up your meal you only have a few minutes to eat. The soup is hot and the pesto chicken sandwich is super flling and very tasty. For someone who has to eat and run back to work this place is great. It is always super busy around lunch time so be prepared and it is not like your normal CPK where the waiters let you order at the table. You order your food at the counter and find your own seat which is fine by me. SO, if you try something there that is super yummy let me know what it is so I can try that on my next lunch break!!!

Not sure what compelled me to try this place given I could have gotten a quick bite at the cafe located inside the outdoor mall. However, it was an interesting dining experience I was not prepared for.  First off, I wasn't sure where the entrance was and ended up going into the "restaurant" through the to-go entrance. Who knew I'd be about-face with the cashier instead of in the back of the line. I had to casually exit through the doors to get inside through the proper entrance and with the rest of other diners waiting to order.  After placing my order for a Thai pizza and fountain soda, I was handed a numbered sign which I was place on the edge of the table. I grabbed a seat and noticed a lot of solo diners. The tables were arranged to accomodate small groups of 4 or so diners.  In any case, my pizza took 12 minutes from the time I ordered. It was freshly made, however, I wish I ordered the crust as whole wheat as it would have cut down on the tangyness of the Thai sauce. A little heavy in my opinion.  Great place to try if you want to have a pizza and I took half of mine home because while waiting for the pizza, I downed two cups of rootbeer. Self-serve fountain drinks get me every single time.
Always crowded, especially at lunch time.  They have one of the best asian chicken salads around.  Other than that it is a chain, but a very consistently good chain.
Half roasted veggie salad is awesome.   Great service by the on-duty manager to make sure things are covered and everyone welcomed.

I work in the Stanford Mall and I have to say that the food options here are limited but I am definitely a fan of the food at CPK Asap. You can either order food at the register and eat the food there or you can get it to go. Or you can go in the to go door and they have pre-made options in the fridge you can choose from to take out. Some of my favorites are the Chopped Salad, BBQ salad, & the White Bean Minestrone Soup. They are really friendly about doing certain changes to menu items since I am on a diet and have them take out certain things like tortilla strips, extra cheese, etc. and they are very accommodating and nice I have tried things like the pizzas which are quite delicious as well. Service is generally really fast and the food has always been good in my opinion and priced pretty well since it is an ASAP location. There is a good variety of choices and something for everyone.

Just went here with 5 tweens for a birthday dinner.  We were very impressed with the service and the food quality.  Our server, Jorge, was especially attentive even though most of the table was ordering kids' meals.  There was something for everyone on the kids' menu and I really enjoyed the bbq chicken salad.     Can't wait to come back.

The food was actually pretty good. But the service was horrible. Our waitress was doing everything but serving us. From refilling my ice tea to asking for a side of ranch and getting it at the end of my meal.

I ate here when I visited Stanford U for the first time, several months ago. I headed over to the shopping center after my visit. Anyway, I had great pizza. It was mushroom, pepperoni and sausage and was delicious. It was very inexpensive and honestly tasted better than I expected. They have fountain and bottle drinks so I had Arizona Green Tea with mine. The service was great! I'd definitely visit again, though I didn't get a chance to on my second visit to Stanford U a few weeks ago. I do have this place in mind though for when I am in that area and want inexpensive but delicious pizza.

We went here for dinner. I had the chicken piccata. It was ok but a bit too sour. The BLT Pizza was gooood:) I can't recommend the mediterranean focaccia (bread) from the small cravings menu. It's nothing special and usually you get bread for free as an appetizer. They have a good menu and a lot to choose from. The service was just ok. We had outdoor seating. Don't sit next to the railing where the waiter always come out and go back in. It's so loud. I don't understand why they don't put anything between the gate and the railing so it's not that annoying anymore.

I wanted to get a real meal before getting dessert at Sprinkle's cupcakes and CPK was near by so my boyfriend and I decided to eat here. I got the Hawaiian pizza because that's my favorite kind of pizza. Overall, the pizza was pretty decent. I did also get the Four Cheese Ravioli. It was so yummy probably because I'm a big fan of pasta dishes. I didn't even wanna share it with my boyfriend cause it was that good lol. We got our food pretty fast and the employees were real nice. It was a good experience for me and my boyfriend since it was our first time trying CPK.I even asked him if he knew what CPK was and didn't even know about this place or what it stand for but now he knows :p

This CPK feels more like a fast food instead of a sit down restaurant..lol. When you walk in, you order, pay, grab a number, and then find your own table to sit. When I came here with my boyfriend, it was really packed.  We had trouble finding a table, too.  After standing with our number for 10 minutes, we saw a couple get up.  I rushed over to grab it before someone does. =)  I notice sometimes you have to stalk or stand close to a table in order to get a seat! We ordered a 12 inch bbq chicken pizza.  It did take a while for our pizza to come out.  After 20 minutes, I saw a server walking around with our pizza trying to find our number.   The bbq chicken is always a favorite of mine at CPK.  There was a good amount of chicken and bbq sauce.  The pizza was delicious. =) I like how this location sells a personal size pizza (9 inch).  I think all the CPKs should have this option.

This review isn't for the food. I love CPK regardless. Roasted Garlic Chicken, Thai Chicken Pizza, and Thai Salad Crunch is always a winner for me. My review is mainly for the service. It was awesome. I think for a semi fast food joint they did a good job. The food runner girl I didnt catch her name was really friendly and made sure we had everything before she left to tend to something else. The manager I think even stopped by to ask if everything was good. Can't complain about that especially since its the holiday season and a weekend!

Arrived for an early lunch and to beat the crowd. So glad I did because the restaurant and the patio area were packed by the time I left. The service was ok. Our server wasn't particularly friendly. She looked like she didn't want to be there and barely cracked a smile. Thankfully the good food made up for her lack on enthusiasm and the kitchen must've been working hard because we didn't have to wait long for our order. The layout of the restaurant is somewhat poorly designed. It can be a bit of a challenge simply walking to the restrooms because the tables and chairs are in the way.

For a quick lunch during your Stanford Shopping Center escapades, you can't go wrong with CPKASAP. Walk in, order at the counter, take your number, find a seat, get your food, and eat. The menu is more limited than a typical CPK, but still has a lot of selection. I ordered a half tuna salad sandwich and a bowl of broccoli and asparagus soup. Got my food within 5 minutes! The sandwich was pretty bland, but the soup was flavorful and was perfect for a chilly day. Summary: 3.5/5 stars rounded up +Food comes out ASAP +Great value -Cramped and crowded

This isn't your typical vanilla CPK. CPK ASAP has more of a fast food vibe - order at the counter, get your own utensils, refill your own drink, etc. I don't mind this aspect but it was different. My issue is more with the food. To start off, we got some artichoke & spinach dip which came with tortilla chips. First bite... STALE. The chips must have been left out for a while, they really, really had no crunch to it. My pizza came out okay, but it took forever to arrive. Isn't this place called ASAP for a reason? My food came out almost 10 minutes later than the other people in my party. Next time, I'll probably just go to a regular sit-down CPK.

Ordered an original chopped salad with a large pizza. Ended up with BBQ chopped salad, how do you screw that up? When the original chopped salad arrived, it looked completely different than the original chopped salad at the regular CPK. so disappointing.  Then I ordered 2 more salads and 2 more pastas to go. They screwed up that order too and gave me 2 salads and 1 pasta, and spilled a drink on me on top of that. The manager was nice enough to give me the other missing pasta at 50% off, although I think he should have just comp'd it. If I were him I would have just comp the pasta and let me walk away happy. Instead he had me pay the $5 and I still walked away unhappy and never going back. Food is not as good as the original CPK and the service is wack. No thanks. And P.S. it wasn't even busy.

California Pizza is a dilemna to me.  On the one hand, I like some of their food quite a bit, such as the pastas.  I have had enjoyable meals here.  I like the decor and atmosphere too - a little noisey but upbeat.  It screams fun. On the other hand. they don't make pizza.  Simply putting stuff on baked dough does not make a pizza.   If you toasted a piece of bread, put chicken and ketchup on it, would you call it "pizza"?  It might be a VERY nice meal, but would you call it "pizza"? There is a particular pizza flavor, and you can get it all over the world it seems, in endless variations.  I love simple cheese plus tomato sauce, but even if you stick ham and pineapple on it, the pizza flavor comes through. "California Pizza" seems to go out of their way to offer "pizza" that has not even a hint of pizza flavor.   Why is this a big deal?  Because pizza is something very special, and they pretend to offer it, but they don't.   If you ordered filet mignon at a steakhouse, and they served you hamburger, would you object?  Even if it was a great hamburger?   Bottom Line:  Good food, bad pizza.  If they did not have "pizza" in the name, if they did not try to pawn this stuff off as pizza, I'd give them 4 stars.  It's a fun place to eat.

I got a chicken club panini for lunch today.  It was pretty good -- I finished it.  (I usually don't finish food I get at restaurants.)  It was a bit difficult to tell the difference between the flavors (chicken, cheese, avocado, bacon) -- the experience was more like melty cheese on toast with protein, but maybe that is what panini are about.  (Or maybe the tomato I can't stand and had them leave off was the crucial flavor component to the dish!)  The food options at the Stanford mall are kind of scattershot, but I was happy with what I got.  FWIW, the place was really busy at 2 PM (on a Saturday, though) and I still ended up waiting around 10 minutes for the sandwich.  Eh, it beats waiting around at a real table service joint or going to McDonald's.   I'd go here again if I wasn't in the mood for a tasty burger at the Creamery...

Is it weird that I've never been to CPK before? One semi-cold evening a few months ago, we decided to eat here for a quick dinner. (Hence ASAP) Why here? Because I was at Sprinkles Cupcakes, duh! A word to the wise though, if you're planning on hardxcore partying after your meal...don't eat too much green stuff like spinach dip and pesto pizza. Unless you want your **rf to look like the incredible hulk's. On another note, skip the spinach dip. The cheese is so weirdly translucent and the frozen spinach was gross. The pizza was do-able.

I could think of no better reason to create a Yelp account than to inform others of my review of the incredibly horrible service at this location. BEWARE: you might be call to place a catering order and they'll say "We're too busy to take your order, we'll call you back." You might wait an hour for them to call you back and when they don't you might call them again. I've never heard a "we're too busy to help you" before. You might ask if the $50 salad comes in a "large aluminum catering tray" and when Tino, the supposed manager, says "YES" you might believe him, even after confirming with him that's what they're served in.   But they don't, they come in a dinky plastic bowl, serving roughly 7 TOPS.  ****  RIP OFF!!!!   *** His excuse when I called back was "he didn't understand me before." Really? You're a "manager" and don't understand the difference between plastic bowl& aluminum tray. Hmmm. *** Tino: "What do you want me to do? That's what our salads come in." Me: "I want you to tell the truth like an adult and say you don't understand if in fact YOU DON'T UNDERSTAND!!" *** Further, you might go in to pay for said large catering order and they might give you attitude about how "they don't take credit cards." REALLY?!!  Might be something you'd let me know when I gave my cc information over the phone.  With all these "mights", I'd say you're better off going somewhere that won't give you attitude.  There's another CPK in PA that will undoubtedly have better service.  No mights about it.... They've lost our business for good.

Before I get started - let me just say that I'm a HUGE fan of CPK. Love their menu, from their pizza's to the salads. So, I placed a phone order 3 hours ahead prior to picking it up, and I specifically told the girl to sub out the avocado's for the grilled chicken. After placing my order, she reassured me that it'll be ready for pick-up around the time I requested. Three hours later (on my lunch break) I dropped in to pick up my phone order, and I was grateful that they had my order ready for me, BUT I glanced down at the half Thai crunch salad that I had ordered and I see avocado slices everywhere. I was so upset, because they had plenty of time to prepare one half salad w/ no complicated requests but to simply sub out the avocado's for grilled chicken. There were three girls standing near the register, giggling and discussing their weekend plans & completely ignoring me while I was trying to get someone to help me. I informed the girl that brought me my order that I didn't want the avocado's. She grabbed the salad & dashed off without saying a word. By this time, I was already ticked off. First off, I placed my order 3 hours in and I ordered one item. You would think they would get it right. I only had 30 mins and I wasn't happy about wasting my lunch standing there waiting for my food, AND to top it all off, she comes back w/ my newly made salad & shoved it in the bag and walked off without saying one word. Not one employee apologized for the delay or the mistake. I used to love coming here for lunch, but I'm no longer coming to this specific location because of their poor service and the employees simply aren't courteous. Bad service and very rude employees!

3.5 STARS My boyfriend and I were really hungry after a long night and this was about to be our first meal of the day. We noticed the "ASAP" above the name and wondered why it said that. REASON: Order before you get seated.  We came in just before the huge rush of people and luckily found seats. This place is small and can only accommodate 150 people. The personal space between each table is small so you end up awkwardly squeezing yourself between the tables to get to your seat.  So, you wait in line.
