Cashier calls you, order, pay, and then get seated. I don't think I waited any longer than 12 minutes before my food arrived. I had a half-sandwich/half-salad combo with their new specials: Moroccan chicken salad, and cranberry walnut chicken sandwich. The Moroccan chicken salad was veryyyy good! It had huge pieces of avocado, hard-boiled eggs, beets, cranberries, and squash. The chicken sandwich had a ton of cranberries in it and placed between amazing cheese and herbs bread (reminded me of Subway's bread but this one tasted much better).  I like this concept better than the regular CPK because it's so much faster.
I lied - I've gone  back several times - the food is actually better now!

I love CPK and I love that there is now a CPK express so you can still get the same food (well...a smaller selection), but not be out of the office for too long. Also, for those really lazy bums (or for those in a hurry), you can pick up your food curbside and not even have to get out of your car.  Thai chicken pizza, bbq pizza, and bbq chicken salad are must haves at any CPK location.

CPK is a great place to eat.  The food is very high quality and the service quick and friendly.  Every CPK is the exact same in every respect, which is good because you know you are getting good food, good service, and a nice atmosphere. If you have never had CPK before, you MUST try it at least once.  I don't know a single person who doesn't like CPK.

Not all that quick, and really hard to find a table to sit down if you come at the wrong time.  My family was walking around the mall when the kids decided that they are hungry when we walked by CPK. Fine, let's head in and grab a bite. The line wasn't that long to the cashier, but the wait took quite some time. I was also searching for a table which fits my family of 4 as well, and that was next to impossible. Luckily, the table that was sitting right by the cashier saw my dilemma and told me that they are leaving (that table also had kids so they can understand). We sat down, and finally the ordering took place and we all settled into our new table.  Since we just "inherited" this table from the previous family, it has not been cleaned and finding a waiter to clear our table was another difficult task. It wasn't until after our food arrived did we get the table cleared of all the old dishes.  The dining experience was just ok, nothing spectacular at this "gourmet pizza establishment". We also ordered a pasta dish (not from the kids menu) so the kids can eat it, but it wasn't very tasty and hence, they didn't eat much.  Needless to say, this all summed up to be a not so great experience. I understand how popular this place is being in Stanford Mall, but if they cannot control the crowd and have their paying customers get seats, they will probably stop coming through the doors.  Just some advice to the management so they can better accommodate to future customer experiences.

3+ I'm pretty stingy with stars, so understand a 3+ is pretty good. My employer brought in sandwiches, Caesar salad, and pasta for the the hungry folks here at Plaxo (have you seen our new Social Networking tool?).  For eats, I went for the Chicken Caesar Sandwich--a favorite of mine. Since I had the Caesar flavor right in my sandwich, I opted to pass on the green salad. I tried the pastas, but they were too oily for my taste. I'm not complaining--the sandwich hit the spot.

I was in the area on a Friday afternoon and went there with my uncle and his friend. ASAP means you order your food when you walk in at the cashier and they give you a number to bring with you to find an open table.  It was busy but we had no problem finding a table, and the service was GFF: Great, Fast and Friendly.  The menu was divided into Pizzas, Paninis, Sandwiches, and Salads, and overall was a good size if you don't need too many dishes to choose from.  I had the Honey Dijon Chicken and Bacon panini and it didn't fall apart and tasted good. The meal came with a house salad with an option of fresh pepper which was good and I also bought a drink, all for under $10. The restaurant was clean and comfortable. No complaints from me about this place it was an overall good experience and I would recommend it to anyone at the Stanford Mall and hungry at the same time.

The re-model looks really nice..I love the avocado egg rolls! The tiramisu is to die for!!! The fried macaroni kinda sucked tho. Not much flavor. My husband and I sat at the bar since we were getting something light. The bartender was very nice.. She was from Poland I think. (u need to ask for bread when u sit at a bar people it's not an automatic thing---for the former reviewer ;)..the only thing that sucks about this place is there's no happy hour!! Who in the he'll doesn't have happy hour? This is the only place! Other than that we had a great experience and will be coming back!!

I'm going to give negative review on this place. Even though the food was tasty, service wasn't.  My friends and I (total 7 people) went there last week after visiting Stanford University.  I asked our server HUGO for 3 separate orders.  Hugo took our orders.  We had salads and pizzas. After receiving checks I found out that each check has 18% gratuity, which is kind of high for such a service. I asked him "why tips are including in check and so high?" He answered something like "because it is party gratuity" Then I asked "how many people are considered as a party?" He wasn't sure and said 8 and up. OK. There are 7 of us. Will it make any different?  I wasn't satisfied with his answer and decided to speak with a manager. He wasn't aware what's going on so answered that party - 8 and up. But when I explained that 18% is a bit high gratuity since we are not a party, he started wriggle and cover Hugo. I was frustrated. I thought that tips are the way of appreciation for the service rendered and totally free will. Turned out I was wrong. Will avoid this place in future.

CPK is the way to my heart. It's better than Round Tables & Pizza Hut & even Mountain Mike's, although that last one is pretty good in my book too. I'm not big on pizza (I'll eat it but I tire of it easily) but I feel as if I would enjoy any kind of pizza from CPK! I've yet to try more! I haven't tried any of its pasta seeing as pizza is its specialty, but maybe next time, cos there will be a next time!

Why do they only have one person on the take out window from 11:30am - 1:30pm. The manager helps, but put another employee there to push the line. Take out is curbside and people picking up at the take out window. Really seems stressful and not pleasant for the customer.

I'm sick.  I came here because my lunch buddy wanted to go here.  She was suffering from a broken heart (and I'm always a sucker for that).   This place was packed at lunch today -- is it always?  We split a pizza and it was okay, I guess.  I like having ample elbow room and some privacy.  You won't get either, here.  I'm not fond of hearing others' convos and vice versa, but you can't avoid that here.  Did I mention I'm sick?  I'm a baby when I'm sick, so bear with me.  The food was pizza and meh.  Insert line about sex and pizza.  The drink was diet Pepsi.  This place was packed and I've got a cold.   = 2 stars.  Aaachoo!

Really like CPK in general and this place is like a more casual, self-service version of it.  I LOVE the Adobe Chicken Chowder, the Thai Crunch Salad, and the Sicilian thin-crust pizza. Mmmmmm....really just a great place for lunch or a casual dinner with friends.  I usually find myself here for lunch whenever I"m shopping at the mall.

I really love their pizza. And the service at this place is top-notch. I usually order take-out, and they always have it ready, packed nicely, and the order is always right. Their staff know how to handle a busy service, and they do their work quickly and efficiently. I appreciate good service, and CPK gets a gold star.

I never been to a CPK asap ever! I didn't really understand why it was an "express" CPK because you can still eat there like any other. But anyway, the food was great and you really can't go wrong with anything on the menu. But just a warning not everything on a regular CPK menu is on a ASAP menu. Urgh i was craving the pear pizza they had, and come to find out they didn't carry that, I was bummed, but I ordered the BBQ chicken and the tortilla soup on the side, I was happy again!
The chicken club panini was so good for $7.95 I think and the large bbq pizza for $14.99 is more than reasonable. I like this place.

I have decided I like CPK ASAP more than CPK. This place has a different menu and is take-out style. The pizza selection here is a lot smaller than regular CPK restaurants but believe it or not, I come to CPK ASAP for sandwiches not the pizza (although their original BBQ chicken pizza is the best). The CPK ASAP menu has a larger selection of sandwiches like pannis (my favorite). They let you choose one of four (maybe 3, can't remember) breads. I like getting my sandwiches with the pizza dough, they just stuff all my sandwich stuff in a pizza dough and grill it panni-style. It's definitely become one of my favorite sandwiches.
Good food for the mall. You don't get very many choices for a family with kids. The place is simple and quick and the kids are happy...ahhhh...

This place pretty much sucks.  First of all, the best thing CPK makes is their CPK Club Salad.  (Which is just a Cobb Salad.)  The limited menu at this CPK doesn't have this salad on the menu.  Nor does it have pasta.  What's the deal?  They limit the menu items so that you can get your food quickly.  Well, I was there last night, trying to get a pizza to-go.  After 15 minutes, my boy asked if our pizza was almost done.  He was met with "Oh...we forgot to put it in the oven.  It'll be 8 more minutes."  We were given a coupon for a free meal there, but I would've rather been reimbursed for that meal.  The wild mushroom with chicken pizza was good...especially the crust, but it wasn't worth a 25 minute wait.  And it wasn't a Cobb Salad.

I just love the idea of calling in your order and picking it up curbside!  You don't even have to get out of your car!  It's perfect if you're just picking up lunch!  Their pizza dough is awesome!  I like how it's not too tough and chewy.  Their Thai chicken pizza, Margherita Pizza, and their roasted garlic are YUMMY!  I like the blend of California & Italian cuisine together...it works...and it tastes good!

I like CPK in general.  I visit this one the most often since it's in the mall and I'm always at the mall.  I LOVE the BBQ chicken salad (dressing on the side so it's not so heavy).  I also like the pizzas here (not too thick crust, good taste).  I like the works.
The salads used to be very good at some point. Recently I got a grilled vegie and it has no taste or flavors and was very ordinary.

We arrived at 3:30 PM. Our party had 4 adults and 2 children. We were told the wait would be for 20 minutes.   After 30 minutes, the restaurant was about 1/4 empty ( I counted) yet we were still waiting. None of the tables were being bused and I counted at least 4 to 6 workers who were visibly standing there doing nothing but talking to each other. I asked if we were going to be seated soon and they replied that  the customers were taking longer than normal. I spotted a large table that I thought my  party was going to sit at. It took about 15 minutes for the table to be cleaned and readied after the table was empty. And the restaurant was still about 1/4 empty. There were lots of workers but they were very inefficient. Total time was 45 minutes of waiting! Four stars for the food, zero stars for customer service.

I know this a chain restaurant.. But I feel like every restaurant is different from the managers, workers, food and atmosphere. I went in for dinner after work during the Warriors final game 1. I know they were busy but our waiter was really attentive and remembered everything I requested. Cpk has one of my favorite salads which is the Bbq chicken salad with avocado. It's pretty pricey but worth it. And I always get there egg rolls. Amazing!!  One thing I got to say is that since I was waiting for a seating inside they said it was going to be a 15 min. And so I gave the host my name and said I was gonna be back. When I got back she said she gave my table away?? Like, do you not remember which conversation we had...

I came here because everywhere else was super packed and crowded. It's safe to say I probably won't come here again. I ordered the garlic alfredo with shrimp. The pasta was a little heavy but the shrimp was too salty and threw off the taste of the rest of the dish. I would not recommend coming back here again.

Less then thrilling service.  We ordered shots of Patron Tequila and received 1/8 of a normal bar shot size still at $14 a premium shot.  Place gets crowded.  PF Chang is much better option on the same shopping plaza.

I love coming to this location, not really because of the food, but because the waiters are always so friendly and seem to love their job.  They also love our giant dog and give him so much attention while we eat (a good distraction from our food!).  The outside seating is nice, and has heat lamps to keep us nice and warm during the colder months. The pizzas are good; nothing special, but there are a lot of unique, creative options. To be honest, sometimes their pizzas taste like the frozen varieties I buy at Safeway.  But I do love coming here every so often, and it has always been a pleasant experience.  The food always comes right away, and the prices are very reasonable.

I like California pizza kitchen in general, but not at this location.  We had Margarita pizza, avocado club egg roll and a kid's Hawaiian pizza.  The kid's pizza is decent size unlike some other places.  margarita pizza is thin crust.  It is thin but not crispy at all.  The crust is soft and soggy.   Sundae is quick disappointed.  We ordered two sundaes.  Ice cream part is melted when served on both cups.  I am not sure how long the sundaes are in room temperature.  I would not recommend this store, but will go to other locations in the future.

The staff was friendly, the atmosphere was great, pizza is fresh out of the oven. We ordered a 14" mushroom pepperoni sausage pizza and it was delicious! It didn't take so long for us to get our food, about 10 minutes for one pizza. The place wasn't crowded, we sat outside because it was overly air conditioned inside lol.  One star off because we didn't receive a pizza slice server like the others sitting by us & the waitress dropped one of those napkin wrapped fork/ knife thingies and never came back with another.

This location has a great atmosphere. Unfortunately; that brings long lines. The food was great and our server never missed a beat. The only complaint I have is that they charge for plain old soda water as if I was guzzling cokes through my lunch. Otherwise, a great location and better food.

Came here on a Thursday afternoon for lunch with a GF. The place was pretty packed but we didn't have to wait long for a table. This CPK is pretty small compare to other CPKs I've been to. There's outdoor seating also. Which is a bonus for Palo Alto's sunny weather. Here's what we ordered: cobb salad thai crunch salad lettuce cups Everything was fresh. I highly recommend coming to CPK for salads. They have a good variety to choose from. The staff at this location was friendly and welcoming. Especially our waitress. Didn't catch her name. She was wearing a pink top and pregnant. She was super sweet.

NOTE: I am giving this place 4.5/5 stars, not 4. On a nice day, make sure you sit outside in the warm sun. The outside area is perfect for a lunch stop while shopping and they are outside pet-friendly! My mom and I love to come to CPK for their salads and pizzas.  Try the spinach and artichoke pizza and add avocado! So. Good. While the outside area is nice, be prepared for very slow service. Most likely the slowest service out of all the CPK's i've been to (and I have been to a few). GOOD: -Food is delicious as always -Outside area is beautiful on a nice day and they have heat lamps on cold days -Great for lunch in between shopping -Outside pet-friendly! Our waiter gave our pup some water to drink. BAD: -Very slow service, don't sit outside if you're in a hurry.

Only difference between an ASAP and a regular CPK: you order your food and get it while walking down the counter,  CAFETERIA style.. or get your number and wait until they deliver it at your table...which is nicer also :) (I only get their pizzas/salads here most of the time..Their pastas have usually been a failure pick for me.. Definitely not a place for pasta if you are craving for it!)

The food is really really good. Their ingredients are always very fresh. For the customer service I can't say anything bad. Our server was Jorge, he was very outgoing, present and anticipating our needs. He even joked a little bit with us, he was like I expect a server to be. Being french and uses to a french service, its very important for me that the server is smilley, funny, polite and present. I really like to sit on the patio, very sunny!

We have gone to this location several times and normally have a good experience. The servers are friendly, food comes out relatively quickly, and is normally prepared to order. Today was an off day, but we will be thinking twice prior to going again. Our order took a very long time to come out and was not only incorrect, but dishes we order often did not taste good at all. We were in a hurry so we were unable to have things remade as it took so long to come out, but the waitress made comments about knowing it came out incorrect and delivered it anyway. Like I said, normally pretty good and great location, but today was disappointing and unsure if we will go back.

Saturday night I visited the restaurant after 7PM with my girlfriend. When we walked in it was busy and people were in line. They told us that two people were ahead of us and that we would have to wait for 25 minutes. I took a walk and then I went back to check 25 minutes later. The lady then told me that three people were ahead of us so, politely, I made sure she knew that arithmetic is not an opinion. 15 minutes later we were seated. I looked through the menu and I could not really find anything particularly enticing. I had pizza at lunch and I ended up choosing pizza for dinner as well when I decided to try an original BBQ chicken pizza. The pizza itself was good and flavorful but nothing out of the ordinary. Later on I ordered a Belgian chocolate soufflé cake which I was expecting to be softer because a soufflé should be soft but it was very much like a brownie which is something that I don't really go crazy for anyway. Jorge was our waiter. He was very polite and courteous, even sarcastic but in a good way. He often came back to check on us. The food we ate was decent but, honestly, this place does not elevate cooking in any manner. It's just another restaurant that belongs to an overrated chain. I find the menu restricted and I don't see anything glorious about eating at California Pizza Kitchen.

Went on a Saturday night to CPK so the place was very packed. The menu is set outside for those who want to check what they offer and prices. Since it was a 25 minute wait, they offer to give them my   phone number  so I could go shopping while our table was ready. The server was so nice and very attentive to our needs. Totally recommend  the meat cravers pizza. Cons: The pizza very small so each person should by their own if they want to get full. I didn't since the host told me that the one pizza could be shared by two people which is not true. Only one size;10inches(6 slices). The wait is long,30 minutes to get the food served. Overall, a great place near a shopping center, outside seating for those who want to  enjoy the weather and dog friendly.

It didn't impress but it didn't disappoint either. The waitress was super friendly and new the menu like the back of her hand. I ordered tacos that we okay. Like 3 1/2 stars would be adequate. I order the fish tacos and was expecting more of authentic flavors. It's more of a closes law and BBQ fish feel to it. They are good, just not what I was expecting. It was a little on the pricey side too. I didn't expect to pay that much and still leave hungry. I know their pizza is great, just skip pass those tacos.

shopping and patio seating...dog friendly mall and restaurant...bowl of water for the animals...bottle of nobilo sauvignon blanc for the humans...light, crisp and refreshing wain...white corn guacamole and chips to start...sweet crisp corn and avocado a good combination...cheap and only $four starter....waiter recommendation being the chicken tequila fettuccine $thirteen....great creamy saucing and perfect pasta...finding a favorite pasta dish at cpk...waldorf chicken salad $fourteen for greens balance...finding chicken loaded and fruity...balsamic vinaigrette choice for lighter taste...crisp, cheesy and walnut salad creation...meal and drinks for $seventy total for two...

Cpk is always the restaurant of choice when we are at Stanford mall.  The variety of food choice fit everyone in our family.  Kids love their fusilli. Granny loves their soup and noodle. We love their salad. The servers are friendly.  Nice restaurant for the family. Only thing- the waiting time can be quite long on weekends.

This is my typical family get-together restaurant. I've dined here ever since I was born and it always tastes better every time we come. We're never disappointed with the service or food.  My family's traditional order is 1 Large Wild Mushroom Pizza, 1 Medium Field Greens Salad, and 2 traditional cheese kids menu pizzas. Recently they have all been slightly altered. The original Wild Mushroom Pizza had their mushrooms wet and soggy. (Yes it does not sound too appetizing, but it actually tastes better since the mushrooms are easier to chew) The pizza wasn't too thin, and the dough was slightly sweet. Now they have changed the recipe so that the mushrooms don't get to be boiled, instead they are thrown onto the pizza, dry. The crust is also harder and not really sweet. The Field Greens Salad Dish was a salad with a variety of greens and leaves of all colors.  My family tradition was to exchange the chicken for shrimp and add extra walnuts. The walnuts were sugar coated which made them delightful to eat, and there were also apple slices. Together the salad tasted sweet, a tad bit sour (from the apples) and salty too. The texture was soft from the salad, chewy from the shrimp, and hard from the walnuts all at the same time. Now they have modified the salad to have goat chees mixed in, and to take out the apples. It changed the texture and flavors a ton, and it's no longer one of our favorite dishes, but we still order it for old time's sake. The kids cheese pizza was and still is just plain cheese pizza but smaller, with a sweeter thicker but softer crust. The only changes that have been made is that the dough is now thinner, and the pizza is cut into smaller pieces.   Overall still one of my favorite places to be. The staffs have always been polite and joyful when they're serving. The aura is always pleasant at CPK. Keep up the good work!

Nothing special, but good consistent food at a place where you can bring the kids.  Definitely one of the better options at the mall.  Salads are good as well as the pizzas (of course) -- we choose to get our pizza "Neapolitan style" (meaning thin, crispy crust), which you can do for any of the pizzas, not just those specified on the menu.   Great bonus is that you can call ahead your order and pick it up curbside without even getting out of your car.  Wish more restaurants in Palo Alto had that option!
I love that you can call when you arrive for pickup and they will bring it to your car. The food is always good, and they have the BEST tortilla soup!!

Probably the best restaurant at the mall. We ordered Sicilian pizza, a chicken sandwich, and a side salad. The pizza was spicy enough, but I wasn't a fan of the too-crisp salami. And the crust was just sad. I prefer Costco, to be honest. The sandwich was a different story altogether. The bread's topped with melted cheese and filled with soft, chewy chicken. I liked the side salad too. Forgot to ask for the dressing on the side, but they didn't just pour a cup of dressing on it. Thanks, CPK.

i never realized this cpk was an express style until i had lunch there this afternoon. upon entry my friend and i questioned as to why the word asap was a part of the sign, but once we walked in and saw the layout of the restuarant we quickly understood. a little past noon and it was not crowded at all. the menu, ordering and seating process was simple- make a selection from the large menu bolted on the wall, turn around and order at the cashier, choose a seat and wait for the food to be served. drinks are self serve from the fountain and there are plenty of tables, booths, and counter tops to choose from. pretty convenient system for those of us with only and hour or so to spare for lunch, especially at peak dining hours. my friend and i shared a buffalo chicken pizza and a cup of soup each. i had the tomato basil and he had the chicken chowder, both came with a piece of bread. the soups we good, not too water and full of flavor. tasted exactly how it's supposed to. the pizza had an extra twist to it too. blue cheese and celery! which was perfect considering it was buffalo style. honestly, i'm not really a big fan of pizza and when my friend wanted to order it i was thinking i'd eat much of it anyway. but it turned out enjoyable enough where a non-pizza eater like me helped herself to three slices! great for a quick bite to eat, such as lunch. only down side is that the menu selection isn't as wide as the usual cpk restuarants. i actually had my mind set on pasta upon walking in. but for conveniently being the only place at the standford shopping center that offers the half soup half sandwich combo, i'll definitely be back for another rainy day lunch.
I like the Thai chicken pizza here.  Sit at the booth and you can see all the goings on in the kitchen.  At least I know it's fairly clean!  No rats running around here!

I pick up food from this CPK location on occasion and it's consistently very good and quick service.  The curbside pickup is nice for a quick dinner.  My favorite menu item is the Tortilla Soup and CPK's bread is always tasty.  I also like the Waldorf salad a lot - the chicken was good quality as was the apples/grapes in the salad, as it should be for a $7+ salad!  The chicken panini sandwich is usually great as well.
great the thai chicken salad or chinese chicken salad.  bbq chicken salad or the tricolor salad pizza with grilled chicken or shrimp are also great choices
CPK is good. The employees here are fabulous! They always remember my name even when I havent been to their restaurant in a few weeks. The red velvet cake is AWESOME!!

got this for lunch today. gotta say i really reallly reallly wanted to try the chinese chicken salad but they couldnt make it WITHOUT cilantro. it was premixed. i was prettty bummed. so i had to settle for a pepperoni pizza. it was good, but nothing special. not too much pepperoni on the pizza.. it was like a cheese pizza with maybe a pepperoni or two on each slice. i want my meat!
this place isn't the best pizza place in the world.The service is good. Its just their pizza. It doesn't taste very good. If you order a pepperoni pizza there is hardly any pepperoni on it.

Let's not generalize here. This is NOT a regular CPK. This is a CPK-ASAP and their pizza is terrible.  I've had great pizza on University Ave and at Valley Fair CPK.  CPK pizza is crispy thin crust.   CPK-ASAP in Stanford Center is soft and squishy.   This is probably because they don't have wood burning pizza ovens like CPK.  If there was such a thing as lousy pizza, CPK-ASAP makes it.   It reminds me of frozen pizza.  It reminds me of pizza at Fresh Choice.  If CPK-ASAP were a franchise of CPK, I'd challenge CPK to cancel it.  However CPK doesn't franchise so I hold them responsible for having inconsistent quality pizza.  Therefore go to the CPKs that you like. They're all different.
